content:
We are merging about ~25 changes today that clean up some historical quirks in our CSS, some going back to ~2013 timeframe. All of these changes should be "transparent" to users (in most cases figuratively, but in some cases, literally, haha, because we're using "transparent" declarations more intelligently, among other things).

If anybody sees things that seem to have changed, let us know here.
These are generally refactors helping prepare for "night mode", so in particular, be on the lookout for things that are mysteriously the wrong color.

pasted image

This is the compose fade on the floating recipient bar.
Hmm, yeah, that looks like a bug.
I reported a similar bug to Brock yesterday, where if you go into narrow mode, you'll see messages leak behind the right hand side gear.
I suspect these are easy fixes for @Brock Whittaker, and they may lead to cleanup of some of the overly complex legacy nesting of divs.
